message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.CL. 

The paper addresses the problem of action alignment and segmentation in videos, which is a common task in computer vision and multimedia analysis. The proposed method involves discriminative modeling and end-to-end training, which are typical topics in machine learning and deep learning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also introduces a novel approach to address the challenge of weak supervision, which is a common issue in many machine learning tasks. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to sub-categories such as cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CL (Computation and Language). Finally, the paper evaluates its method on two challenging datasets, which indicates that it may also be relevant to cs.MM (Multimedia).
